passivePack

Class Direction

  • java.lang.Object
    • passivePack.Direction

  • public class Direction
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines directions to the West, North, East and South

      Constructs a Direction by using an integer.
      Direction(java.lang.String direction)
      Constructs a Direction by using a string.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Direction

        public Direction(int direction)
          throws InputException
        Constructs a Direction by using an integer. 0-3 is north-west, respectively.
        Parameters:
        direction - The desired cardinal direction.
        Throws:
        InputException - If the integer falls outside {0,3}.

      • Direction

        public Direction(java.lang.String direction)
          throws InputException
        Constructs a Direction by using a string. The direction is specified by the strings "north", "east", "south" and "west".
        Parameters:
        direction - The desired cardinal direction.
        Throws:
        InputException - If the string does not match a specified direction.

    • Method Detail

      • getDirection

        public java.lang.String getDirection()
        Gets the string representation of a given direction.
        Returns:
        The string representation.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object direction)
        Checks if the given direction is equal to this direction.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        direction - The compared object.
        Returns:
        True if direction is of type Direction and faces the same way as this, else false.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • oppositeDirection

        public Direction oppositeDirection()
        Gets the opposite cardinal direction to this direction.
        Returns:
        The opposite direction.
